title: "As long as Tahm isn't sticky he can keep his damage."
body: So how about getting devoured makes you immune to his stacks for 10 or so seconds?  You know so you actually have a window to escape.  Right now Tahm is packing Juggernaut levels of single target damage with actual CC to keep him on you.  Tank, ADC, APC, it doesn't matter, he will get to you and he kill you.

replies.body: Tahm Kemnch isn't sticky! He's a slippery smooth catfish!
I swear to god if that is the pun they were waiting on to nerf him I will strangle a yordle of your choosing (everyone hates at least 1)
I for one, hate them all.

League Puns feel like they're {{champion:86}}teed to come across as {{champion:103}}lly {{champion:67}} attempt at humour. I always feel re{{champion:64}}ycal when I make them, and often emb{{champion:110}}ed afterward.

This is an example of A: Trying too hard
                                     B: Phreak-grade puns
Puns of Damage
Cringe. It's like you tried too hard.
You're calling me a try-hard? Well, {{champion:84}}ou a party cr{{champion:22}}er.

> [{quoted}](name=AYY LMA0,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=B9H7Ux71,comment-id=00000000000000000000,timestamp=2015-12-17T22:38:33.886+0000)

Well, he tried so hard, but in the end, will it ever matter?

to be fair every juggernaut that isn't mordekaiser or illaoi is pretty hard to keep off of you once they're on

tahm is bullshit because he can stick to you even after peeling

I just want his stacks to start their fall-off faster, but each stack individually disappears a little slower. That way Tahm doesn't have a whole 7 seconds to catch back up
A rylais morde is pretty sticky though :)
But Morde ain't innately sticky, unlike the other Jugger%%%%s.

> [{quoted}](name=MrWasjig,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=B9H7Ux71,comment-id=000200000000,timestamp=2015-12-17T10:31:50.701+0000)
>
> But Morde ain't innately sticky, unlike the other Jugger%%%%s.

Neither are they.... They buy 2 items that improve their move speed and apply a slow.

But they have tools in their kit that let them catch people without too much trouble. 
Morde has nothing of the sort.

Ap brusier top {{champion:223}} builds {{item:3027}}  and {{item:3116}}  and doesn't give a shit about your peel. 

he also smacks you with massive Q's to poke.
why would he need rylai's

why not? are you suggesting some insanity like building a second {{item:3027}} ? 

Thats dangerous thinking.  Bard, you should focus on your chimes.
Nah man, go for deadmans plate. Nice auto damage, easy slow, and the you are right next to them to follow up with a q
It provides a good chunk of hp and ap, two things he scales extremely well with. His ult passive increases the worth of the item.

If I just want HP and AP, I can get more of both with a second Rod of Ages, and then I'm also getting mana instead of a Rylai's passive that I literally can't use because my Q already has a larger slow. The only time I could use it is if I spit a minion at someone, but that's such a rare use case out of the laning phase that it's not worth building for.

I think that's probably the most broken thing here : Tahm can literally get you to full stacks from his Q alone. I'm pretty sure he'd be fine without that, as it would require him to commit to a fight to devour someone instead of simple fishing for hits with his Q.

I mean, look at Braum (sure his teammates can proc his stun, but he also won't nuke you down by himself, also he requires more stacks and has a CD). If you get hit by a Braum Q, you don't have to worry about the next Q, you just worry about whether or not the enemy duo engages you on that.

The biggest problem with Tahm is not his damage as much as simply being hit means giving up on lane for the next 7 seconds.

So a stackable debuff that stuns you that can be fired at range and then finished by anyone, in particular, ranged champions, is worse than a stackable debuff that can be fired at range and then completely requires that one champion to waddle up to you and auto you two times and then wait for the Q to come off cooldown in order to stun you?

Except currently, it doesn't work this way.

Imagine if Braum's passive didn't fall off as fast. Braum could literally sit in lane, next to his adc, and fish for Qs.. Any Braum lane would become a hyper-bully lane (rather than only Braum Lucian lanes) because as soon as a Q would hit you, you'd have to back off completely from minions until the stack disappeared or trust in your mechanics to dodge the next one. 

This is what Tahm Kench feels like. Don't get me wrong, I love the guy. I've spammed him an insane amount before the pre-season. He his, by far, the support with the best late-game fantasy possible : _I'm a threat._ No other support based champ can do this. But he has flaws. And one of those is the lack of need to commit in any early fights. Now Braum can, in fact, sit back and fish for Qs, but then he needs someone like Lucian to go ham in his place. Otherwise you'll often have to W to a nearby minion and try to follow up at least a second stack with an AA, at which point you're no longer "sitting back". Also, while an late-game Braum stun can completely change a game, it's no way as deadly as Tahm's devour.

When Leona goes all in she needs to be ready for it. Same with Alistar. Even Thresh can be heavily punished for following a hook. Not Tahm. As Tahm, I can easily sit back, land one Q, wait for the CD, go for the second one, and if it lands it's GG. The enemy's already at 2 stacks, his only possible choice is flashing. And at this point Tahm can't be punished : the enemy has to give up.

> [{quoted}](name=PrincePapa,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=B9H7Ux71,comment-id=0002000100000000,timestamp=2015-12-17T19:59:38.129+0000)
>
> Except currently, it doesn't work this way.
> 
> Imagine if Braum's passive didn't fall off as fast. Braum could literally sit in lane, next to his adc, and fish for Qs..

> Any Braum lane would become a hyper-bully lane (rather than only Braum Lucian lanes) because as soon as a Q would hit you, you'd have to back off completely from minions until the stack disappeared or trust in your mechanics to dodge the next one. 


Yes, if Braum's passive was like that it would be pretty bullshit, but Tahm's passive can't be applied by an ally, that's why his passive gets to last longer than Braums because it doesn't have that extra ease of application.

> 
> This is what Tahm Kench feels like. 

Except it's not how it actually works. If Tahm uses his Q to catch up to you, if you kite him while damaging him then you can bring down his health bar pretty easily at early levels before he has items. Or, if he uses his Q on you and you run into your minions and fight him then he can at most use his W on you at max stacks and be unable to hit you with his Q anymore which means he's not using any of his abilities after that and if it's before he's 6 then you've cut off all of his damage.

>Don't get me wrong, I love the guy. I've spammed him an insane amount before the pre-season. He his, by far, the support with the best late-game fantasy possible : _I'm a threat._ No other support based champ can do this. 
But he has flaws. And one of those is the lack of need to commit in any early fights. Now Braum can, in fact, sit back and fish for Qs, but then he needs someone like Lucian to go ham in his place. Otherwise you'll often have to W to a nearby minion and try to follow up at least a second stack with an AA, at which point you're no longer "sitting back". Also, while an late-game Braum stun can completely change a game, it's no way as deadly as Tahm's devour.
> 
> When Leona goes all in she needs to be ready for it. Same with Alistar. Even Thresh can be heavily punished for following a hook. Not Tahm. As Tahm, I can easily sit back, land one Q, wait for the CD, go for the second one, and if it lands it's GG. The enemy's already at 2 stacks, his only possible choice is flashing. And at this point Tahm can't be punished : the enemy has to give up.

If you're putting yourself in position to be hit by Tahm's Q a second time while you still have a stack on you then that's your fault for not recognizing the risk and playing appropriately.
literally use any mobility to get away
Because EVERY champion in the game has that, right?

if you pick a immobile champ then thats your fault, why pick a illoai or garen, or darious or ect against tahm? yes you can win but it will be hard. counter pick people, your favorite champ wont always be a good pick, and if you didnt have a choice then thats why we have a item and a cleanse to also counter these types of champs.

counterpick isn't a relevant strategy, because what you are actually saying is, never pick anything that tahm can stick to in and blind que or if you have an early pick if tahm isn't banned. thats not balance, that's stupidity.

the only a stupidity is thinking that every champ should have a equal chance in defeating one another. That's impossible. Balance is like rock paper and scissors game, everyone has a killer. you are telling me that in a Quinn vs garen, garen should have a equal chance to kill Quinn? i dont think so, garen could win this but it would be much harder then Quinn winning having a easier match up. that's why we have 100+ champs other wise lets have 10. also keep in mind some champs weakness is laning phase but are amazing in team fights and same goes the other way around, like the old darious, a monster in laning phase but much much less impactful in team fights.

ok then, I'll keep this simple becuase I doubt you can understand anything complex, counterpicking is a strategy, but it is not a relevant strategy when it comes to the balance of a champion. if the only way to reliably beat a champion is by counterpicking them, that means that in 75% of games that the champion is in that champion will not be reliably beaten. this is because counterpicking is only available in draft pick mode, and in draft pick, its about a 50% chance that you will pick before your opponent, and if you pick before your opponent, then you can't counterpick, can you? 

if you are forced to make a pick because another champion might be picked, the champion that might be picked is overpowered.

The way I see it, you should only pick an immobile champ EVER if you meet at least one of these criteria:
A) See enough of the enemy team that you think you feel comfortable to pick it
B) Your team has picked (or you know they WILL pick) someone who can and will help peel for you (thresh janna etc)
C) You literally give 0 f@^&s about your own health and well-being

mobility is a trait to consider when picking a champion, just like burst, range, cc, tankiness and DPS etc.
for example:
{{champion:236}} = burst and mobility (sacrifices consistent ranged DPS and cc)
{{champion:96}} = High Ranged High DPS + Tank Shredding (sacrifices burst and mobility)
{{champion:222}} = Medium - High range DPS + Decent CC (Sacrifices reliable burst / reliable mobility)
{{champion:67}} = VERY High DPS at Medium range + Mobility (Sacrifices burst and reliable cc / waveclear)
and now the best of them all
{{champion:119}} = Amazing at everything (Sacrifices nothing)
this is proof that mobility creep is a problem. this.

Currently , Tahm Kench devour on enemies, don't consume An Aquired taste passive , so after he devoured you, he can literally Q stun so you can't run away. Imagine if Kench goes for 45% CDR ( thanks to masteries) and just spam devour and tongue lash in repeat because he can keep you inside his belly for à whole 3 seconds, so his Q get off cooldown before you can move. After that assuming his devour is level 5, so 10 second cooldown, reduced by 45% CDR, he have 5,5 or so cooldown, so he almost can chain tongue lash stun, and devour until your death, something need to be done...

Nope, the stacks goes away once eaten, do your research pal. 

[Source](http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/Tahm_Kench)

> [{quoted}](name=OrganicT,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=B9H7Ux71,comment-id=000600000000,timestamp=2015-12-17T16:06:06.059+0000)

Stacks go away when eaten, not when stunned. He can also just start stacking them again when he spits you out.
I tested it, stacks are gone after devour.

this is what i mean, people comment about inbalance and been wrong on all info, you guys cry about op champs, but you guys dont take your time to learn them. the stacks are remove after he devours you, then it gets on a long cooldown,
Don't generalize such a huge group.

"Tahm Kench isnt sticky"

HAHA, Oh Riot you funny sons of guns.

Not like he can get full stacks on you in .5 seconds with auto Q auto, then devour, then by the time you get out his Q is almost off of cooldown again, then he can auto Q auto you again, and by the time the absurd slow wears off you're still in range for a stun, then his W is up again and he devours you for another third of your hp.

Not sticky at all, more like a black hole, once you get close to it, you never escape.

> [{quoted}](name=DustyElLion,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=B9H7Ux71,comment-id=,timestamp=2015-12-17T01:27:52.099+0000)
>
> Tank, ADC, APC, it doesn't matter, he will get to you and he kill you.

Now that's just not true, I've never been caught by a Tahm as an APC unless I was horribly out of position or he was given an extra mobility option to get to me that he doesn't normally have (Flash, Kallista Ult, Bard tunnel, etc). No APC should ever be caught by Tahm, just about everyone outranges him and packs CC to stop him from reaching you. If his team helps him reach you then congrats, they're playing the game.

Lol you got downvoted for posting common sense and gameplay advice. Unbelievable.


All hope for these boards of circle jerking Riot haters has been lost.

Eh, there wasn't really any advice in there. My advice for damn-near any champion is simple, "Don't play to their strengths."
{{champion:115}} Are you fighting someone squishy who pokes? Get in his face.
{{champion:90}} Are you fighting a 1v1 death machine? Don't 1v1 him.
{{champion:84}} Are you fighting someone who stealths a lot? Buy a pink.

So, what are Kench's strengths? 
{{champion:223}} Hard to kill, potent CC, can't get him off once he gets on you.
{{champion:12}} {{champion:150}}  {{champion:54}} {{champion:57}} {{champion:75}} {{champion:13}} {{champion:44}} 
So what do you do? You don't play their game. Stay away from them. Look at all the mobility these champions have- they're one-trick ponies without burning Flash. Kiting is a thing. Staying out of engage range is a another thing. Dodging skillshots is also a thing- most of them don't have skillshots because **it makes their job way too hard**. Dodge the tongue and Kench is unable to come at you.
but there's like a 1s downtime between the application of his 2s not decaying 70% slow!

> [{quoted}](name=DONGLORD420,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=B9H7Ux71,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2015-12-17T09:49:08.640+0000)

1.5 seconds, but yes.

Tahm is about as un-sticky as Nunu if he builds CDR.
Which Tahm doesn't...

It provides no health, none of the 20% CDR items do. Go to Champion.gg and look up Tahm and see how they usually only get to 20% CDR at most on support Tahm with top and jungle Tahm seeing only 10% most of the time.
